definition: to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost

sentences.english: But What shall people to do about the broken marriage, the demoralization ?
sentences.chinese: 但是什麼將要做的人們關於殘破的婚姻，敗壞人心？

sentences.english: With convincing power he portrayed the usurpation and corruptions of the papal see.
sentences.chinese: 他有力地抨擊羅馬教廷僭越權限和腐化敗壞的行爲。

sentences.english: It would be corrupting discipline to leave him unpunished.
Ostracized by the community for immoral activities.
sentences.chinese: 因爲道德敗壞的行爲被社會所排斥。

sentences.english: The political scandal tarnished the reputation of the president.
sentences.chinese: 這起政治醜聞敗壞了總統的名譽。

sentences.english: The unworthy son corrupted the ethics and moral standards of the family .
sentences.chinese: 不肖之子敗壞了這家的門風。

sentences.english: When a man cast his eyes on offices, a rottenness began in his conduct.
sentences.chinese: 這就是他們行爲開始敗壞的原因。

sentences.english: The breeze copies to connect Lian to use to pester a blade earthquake to open nearby one flower petal and flustered and frustratedly says.
sentences.chinese: 風影連簾用氣刃震開身邊一片花瓣，氣急敗壞的說道。

sentences.english: He flared up and sputtered out the story.
sentences.chinese: 他勃然大怒，氣急敗壞地說出事實的真相。

sentences.english: All the hatchet job here meant a calculated attempt to demolish the author.
sentences.chinese: 這兒所有的惡毒攻擊都意味着要試圖敗壞作家的名譽。

sentences.english: Tied to a corner of the cellar, such as the ants when Mr Zhang is flustered.
sentences.chinese: 被綁在地窖一角如百蟻鬧心的張志強氣急敗壞。

sentences.english: Still others were on radios calling for air support.
sentences.chinese: 還有人氣急敗壞地用無線電呼叫空中支援。

sentences.english: He discredited my good name with gossip.
sentences.chinese: 他用流言蜚語敗壞我的好名聲。

sentences.english: Reading such silly stories will pervert your taste for good books.
sentences.chinese: 讀這種愚昧的故事會敗壞你對好書的嗜好。

sentences.english: They made an effort to discredit the politician.
sentences.chinese: 他們盡力敗壞那政客的聲譽。

definition: to ignore/to neglect/to treat with contempt
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to cling to/to be reluctant to give up (sth)/to have a fondness for (an indulgence etc)
